Materials do play in as well.  True black shakudo or solid gold would be unlikely to be in the hands of a poor craftsman.  Kyo-kanagushi type work is usually done in muddy copper alloys or occasionally gold plate.  The quality of the carving is not high, either.

Jim  


  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: satcho.michael_harris 
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, February 27, 2008 7:20 PM
  Subject: [nihontostudy] Re: Kyo-kinko


  Jim,

  Is it then safe to say that Kyo-kanagushi is the catch-all and we 
  need look to the materials and workmanship to distinguish from Kyo-
  kinko...or is it solely workmanship?

  Michael

  satcho.com
  http://www.satcho.com Specialists in books related to the study & 
  appreciation of the Japanese sword as art. 
  _______________________________________________

  --- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "Jim Gilbert" <jggilbert@...> 
  wrote:
  >
  > Kyo-kinko is non-Goto (non-Mino, etc.) kinko work from after the 
  Momoyama period. It is often applied to work that is in Goto style 
  but is not Goto main or sideline work. Edo-kinko used to be used 
  similarly for work in the style of Edo region machibori kinko 
  schools, but lately this is generally lumped as "Kyo-kinko" as well. 
  So it truly is a grab bag, but the problem (especially with menuki) 
  is that there is so much Edo period kinko work with no unique 
  character to it that makes it possible to give a more specific 
  attribution.
  > 
  > BTW, generic Edo period kinko work of lower quality than Kyo-kinko 
  is attributed to Kyo-kanagushi.
  > 
  > Jim
  > 
  >

  > Hi Ron,

  > My understanding is that Kyo-Kinko is the new name for Waki-Goto. 
  This would 
  > make them a grab bag like Ko-Kinko or even Shoami. Their dates 
  are post-Ko-
  > Kinko, so early Edo to Bakumatsu. There is a Kyo-Kinko book out 
  there. I think the 
  > title is Kyo-Kinko no Kenkyu (research into Kyo-Kinko) or 
  something like that. Jim 
  > is probably better up on this stuff then I am.
  > 
  > On on different note, good luck to Harry. Honto ni gambatte 
  kudasai!!
  > 
  > Gordon
